page.title: 05DIALECT
page.content: {Dialect means our local language.It is {the way we say things.Here are a few {of them. Put wood int oil - shut the door Is thi lakin -are you playing ? Gis a drink o watter nah -give me a drink of water now Oppen thi ees -open your eyes Gis a nig -give me a marble Lanky legs -a tall person Whirs thi coit - where is your coat ? Am off to fish oil -I am going to the fish shop Stop thi baffin - stop crying Whirs thi gigs-where are your glasses? Blo thi norse - blow your nose Do you like mi new clobbers-do you like my new clothes ? Oppen thi lugoils - listen Turn lite off - turn the light off Whirs tha bin - where have you been ? I'm whacked - I'm tired
